messages.content:
You are a debugging assistant. You will be presented with a failing test, and tools (functions) to access the source code of the system under test (SUT). Your task is to provide a step-by-step explanation of how the bug occurred, based on the failing test and the information you retrieved using tests about the SUT. You will be given 9 chances to interact with functions to gather relevant information. An example answer would look like follows.

Title: Diagnosis of test `testGenerateURLFragment`
Details: The test `testGenerateURLFragment` checks whether HTML entities such as `"` are correctly escaped to their corresponding character by the `StandardToolTipTagFragmentGenerator.generateToolTipFragment` method. However, the test failure indicates that this is not the case. Following the execution path, we find that `StandardToolTipTagFragmentGenerator.generateToolTipFragment` is not escaping any HTML code; instead, it is using its input `toolTipText` as is. Consequently, un-escaped strings are being returned, which leads to the error demonstrated by the test.

After providing this diagnosis, you will be prompted to suggest which methods would be the best locations to be fixed. The answers should be in the form of `ClassName.MethodName(ArgType1, ArgType2, ...)` without commentary (one per line), as your answer will be automatically processed before finally being presented to the user.

The failing test `org.apache.commons.lang3.builder.ToStringBuilderTest.testSelfInstanceTwoVarsReflectionObjectCycle()` is in the `ToStringBuilder` class. The passing test with the highest token similarity is in the same class. Let's proceed by retrieving the methods covered by failing tests in the `ToStringBuilder` class. Start by calling the `get_failing_tests_covered_methods_for_class` function with the class name `org.apache.commons.lang3.builder.ToStringBuilder`.

messages.name: get_failing_tests_covered_methods_for_class
messages.content: [".reflectionToString(java.lang.Object)", ".getStyle()", ".ToStringBuilder(java.lang.Object, org.apache.commons.lang3.builder.ToStringStyle, java.lang.StringBuffer)", ".getDefaultStyle()", ".toString()", ".getStringBuffer()", ".getObject()", ".reflectionToString(java.lang.Object, org.apache.commons.lang3.builder.ToStringStyle)", ".reflectionToString(java.lang.Object, org.apache.commons.lang3.builder.ToStringStyle, boolean)", ".reflectionToString(T, org.apache.commons.lang3.builder.ToStringStyle, boolean, java.lang.Class<? super T>)", ".append(java.lang.String, java.lang.Object)", ".append(java.lang.Object)", ".ToStringBuilder(java.lang.Object)"]

The `ToStringBuilder` class has several methods covered by failing tests. One of the methods is `.append(java.lang.Object)`, which is called in the failing test. Let's retrieve the code snippet for this method to understand its implementation.

messages.name: get_code_snippet

messages.content: The `append(Object obj)` method in the `ToStringBuilder` class appends the specified object to the builder. It uses the `style` attribute to append the object to the `buffer`. This method is expected to add the object to the string representation being built. Let's proceed by examining the failing test and the method where it fails to understand the issue in more detail.

The failing test `validateNullToStringStyleRegistry()` in the `ToStringBuilderTest` class checks if the `ToStringStyle.getRegistry()` is null. If it is not null, the test fails. This test is called within the `testSelfInstanceTwoVarsReflectionObjectCycle()` method. The error occurred at line 533 in the test method. The stack trace indicates that the test is failing because `ToStringStyle.getRegistry()` is returning an empty map `{}`, which is not null as expected.

The issue seems to be with the behavior of `ToStringStyle.getRegistry()` returning an empty map instead of `null` as expected by the test. This unexpected behavior leads to the failure of the test.

To fix this issue, the method `validateNullToStringStyleRegistry()` in the `ToStringBuilderTest` class or the implementation of `ToStringStyle.getRegistry()` method in the `ToStringStyle` class needs to be corrected to return `null` when there is no registry set.

The methods to be fixed:
```
org.apache.commons.lang3.builder.ToStringBuilderTest.validateNullToStringStyleRegistry()
org.apache.commons.lang3.builder.ToStringStyle.getRegistry()
```

Based on the available information, provide the signatures of the most likely culprit methods for the bug. Your answer will be processed automatically, so make sure to only answer with the accurate signatures of all likely culprits (in `ClassName.MethodName(ArgType1, ArgType2, ...)` format), without commentary (one per line).

m11.content:
The failing test `validateNullToStringStyleRegistry()` in the `ToStringBuilderTest` class checks if the `ToStringStyle.getRegistry()` is null. If it is not null, the test fails. This test is called within the `testSelfInstanceTwoVarsReflectionObjectCycle()` method. The error occurred at line 533 in the test method. The stack trace indicates that the test is failing because `ToStringStyle.getRegistry()` is returning an empty map `{}`, which is not null as expected.

The issue seems to be with the behavior of `ToStringStyle.getRegistry()` returning an empty map instead of `null` as expected by the test. This unexpected behavior leads to the failure of the test.

To fix this issue, the method `validateNullToStringStyleRegistry()` in the `ToStringBuilderTest` class or the implementation of `ToStringStyle.getRegistry()` method in the `ToStringStyle` class needs to be corrected to return `null` when there is no registry set.

The methods to be fixed:
```
org.apache.commons.lang3.builder.ToStringBuilderTest.validateNullToStringStyleRegistry()
org.apache.commons.lang3.builder.ToStringStyle.getRegistry()
```
